text: all right today we're doing a tombow
tuna poached in olive oil a kind of
interesting way to cook tuna and very
easy of course take a very small pot
basically as small as that will fit the
amount of meat you have all right I have
two tuna steaks I cut in half you'll see
that in a second so I put about an inch
of extra virgin olive oil in there I'm
going to crush two cloves of garlic but
basically what I want is a really
flavorful oil mixture and then we'll
poach our tuna right in that now I'm
just gonna keep this pretty simple I'm
gonna go garlic and just whatever fresh
herbs I had around these are from my
garden some thyme some rosemary a little
oregano in fact that's lemon thyme right
there and you can use anything you want
in fact today's down those more of a
technique not so much a recipe all right
same goes for this spice mix I'm going
to use black pepper some smoked paprika
and some salt you can use any kind of
spices you want just whatever you're
into the technique is basically how to
cook it in the oil so what I did is I
took my two tuna steaks again I'm using
albacore tuna known also known as tombow
and I'm gonna give them a nice splash of
this seasoning mixture and again make
sure you always coat all sides hold your
hands up high so it sprinkles evenly
you've heard that trick before all right
so basically once my tuna was all
seasoned again very important to get all
sides that's also going to be for
presentation when we slice it we don't
want one side to have spice on one side
that doesn't alright you're gonna put
your oil mixture on the stove on a low
heat medium low heat just until the
herbs start to kind of bubble all right
and that at that point the oil will be
hot enough and you will have extractable
but you know a lot of that garlic and
herb flavor into the oil then we're
gonna turn it off we're going to add our
tuna into this hot oil and basically
it's gonna cook in about five minutes
for me now you might watch yours cooked
all the way through fine you might want
to only put this in for a minute just to
kind of coat the outside with that hot
oil that's okay too if you like it rare
all right so what I did because that oil
now is pretty much come all the way down
temperature
that tuna was cold I put it out low and
I just gave it like three or four
minutes on low all right very low so
again I don't want to cook it all the
way through personal taste I want a
little bit of pink in the middle but
it's really nice because you got that
spice mix on the outside it got poached
very gently and that really flavorful
herb and garlic oil and I think that
works really nice so for presentation
here see I got a little pink in the
middle I took one of those medallions I
cut it twice so gave me three pieces now
what I use as a base was this incredibly
delicious artichoke crab and potato
croquette which I'm going to show you
tomorrow also known as a crab cake with
potato and artichoke I arranged my nice
medium tuna on top here all right
artfully of course clean your plate and
then I covered it not covered it but I
surrounded it with a beautiful drizzle
of our Citroen ax remember we made that
last week
all right into the Citroen that I added
just a little bit of a hot sauce just to
give it a little just another little
kick all right and there is my delicious
first course
Tombo tuna poached in olive oil on top
of my delicious crab artichoke and
potato croquette I'm going to show that
tomorrow another thing you can do here
which i think is a nice trick you can
actually put in the tuna into the hot
oil like I showed you but don't put the
heat back on just turn it off let it sit
in that oil let it come down the
temperature refrigerate it in the oil
and then when you want to make a
delicious tuna salad or a salad nicoise
with the you know the egg and the green
bean I should demo that salad but anyway
you can crumble that cold tuna over a
salad that's gonna be like the best to
know you've ever had so you can serve
this warm like I am right now by cooking
it through a little more or you can
actually just let it cool in that oil
and you'll have a beautiful look a lot
of people call tuna confit to top
yourself with either way I hope you give
it a try and enjoy and make sure you
stay tuned for the crab potato croquette
demo
enjoy
